com.incors.plaf.alloy
Interface AlloyFontTheme

All Known Implementing Classes:
CustomFontTheme
public interface AlloyFontTheme

An AlloyFontTheme provides the fonts that are used to display text on swing components. To use a custom font theme that implements this interface, follow these steps:

  • Create an instance of the custom font theme.
  • Create a theme with the constructor that takes an AlloyFontTheme as an argument (example: AcidTheme(AlloyFontTheme fontTheme).
  • Set the theme of the AlloyLookAndFeel or use the custom font theme as a parameter of the AlloyLookAndFeel's constructor.
Here is an example for using a the TahomaFontTheme:

com.incors.plaf.alloy.AlloyFontTheme tahomaFontTheme = new com.incors.plaf.alloy.themes.TahomaFontTheme(); com.incors.plaf.alloy.AlloyTheme glassTheme = new com.incors.plaf.alloy.themes.glass.GlassTheme(); com.incors.plaf.alloy.AlloyLookAndFeel alloyLnF = new com.incors.plaf.alloy.AlloyLookAndFeel(glassTheme);


The interface AlloyFontTheme defined methods for providing six different kinds of fonts, which are used for the individual components as follows:

Some hints for implementing custom font themes:
  • Keep in mind that on different systems different fonts are installed. Always provide a fallback font for the case that a font is not available on the system.
  • Most fonts can only display latin characters. Keep this in mind if you are planning to provide localized versions of your software that have to display other characters, e.g. cyrillic or Chinese characters.

Method Summary
 javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getControlTextFont()
          Returns the font used on standard controls.
 javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getMenuTextFont()
          Returns the font used on menus and menu items.
 javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getSubTextFont()
          Returns the font used to display keyboard shortcuts.
 javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getSystemTextFont()
          Returns the font used on tool tips, tree nodes etc..
 javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getUserTextFont()
          Returns the font used on user editable components.
 javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getWindowTitleFont()
          Returns the font used for window titles.
